Description: Hollow terracotta head of Harpokrates, broken from a figure, with finger to mouth. He wears a Double Crown on his full head of hair. The hair is indicated at the back. Two-piece mould. Orange-buff marl ware, with a pink surface. Two fragments re-joined.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased in 1814: P.-E. Towneley; from the collections of Charles Townley. Acquired in Upper Egypt in 1737 by the traveller Richard Pococke. Probably Ptolemaic, perhaps first century BC. Comparandum: Near: Fischer 1994: no. 637, dated second century BC. Bibliog.: Pococke 1745: 187, pl. lxxxi:H.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3078)
